title: Interview with Jasper Mallonga
description: Claire talks to fellow Storymaker Jasper Mallonga about his experience moving from Metro Manila to Winnipeg to Vancouver. (how we met, double check with Jasper). He reflects on the experience of being a first generation immigrant, the feelings that come with migration, and finding community in Canada.
subject: Immigration; Family; Placemaking; Home; Homeland; Generational Differences
location: Manila; Pasig; University of the Philippines
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Darla Tomeldan and Cecilia Tumolva
description: Claire talks to Storytellers Darla Tomeldan and Cecilia Tumolva about growing up in the Philippines, meeting at UP, and their eventual migration to Canada. They discuss the Foreign Domestic Workers Movement, the challenges of being a same-sex couple trying to immigrate together, and how their migration experiences inform their advocacy in the Filipino-Canadian community in Metro Vancouver.
location: Manila; University of the Philippines; Cagayan Valley; Isabela; Perganin; Tumauini; Manila City Hall; San Francisco; Probinsya; Pangasinan; Lingayen
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Kathleen Zaragosa
description: Jocelle talks to fellow storymaker Kathleen Zaragosa about her experience of homemaking as a second-generation immigrant. She reflects on her connection to the Filipino community within her immediate two-block radius and how her Filipino-identity expanded throughout her adolescence.
location: Toronto; University of Toronto; Mount Pleasant; St. Patrick Elementary School; St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Parish
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Stephen Andrada
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Anne Claire Baguio

title: Interview with Maita Santiago

title: Interview with Josh Rasalan
description: Claire talks to Storyteller Josh Rasalan about community work, cultural spaces, and how migration can impact familial relationships. They met through mutual friends in the Filipino-Canadian community and briefly worked together in settlement at Collingwood Neighbourhood House. Josh discusses the importance of community spaces for learning about Filipino culture, but also considers how their understanding of culture and identity started at home, learning about family history and sharing stories with their grandma.
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Alex Montinola
description: Claire talks to Storyteller Alex Montinola about his relationship to Filipino identity and community growing up. They first met as teenagers at a youth poetry slam and stayed in touch as they moved on to different passions. Now a registered psychiatric nurse, Alex also reflects on his career path and what it was like to be a nurse during the COVID-19 pandemic.
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Sammie Jo Rumbaua
description: Jocelle interviews Sammie Jo Rumbaua about her immigration story and how that shaped her early experiences in community building in Vancouver in the 90s. Sammie shares her contributions to the community from mutual aid to Tagalog classes, as well as her motivations for her work.
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Hannah Balba
description: Jocelle interviews Hannah about her experience growing up in a predominantly Filipino community in Richmond and the setbacks she faced after moving to a different part of the city. Hannah shares how she was able to reconnect to her Filipino identity and find mentorship from fellow Filipinos within academic spaces, propelling her to success.
location: Manila; Richmond; University of British Columbia
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Niña Labuguen
description: Jocelle interviews Niña about her unique immigration experience as a Filipino international student from Mexico who is now based in Vancouver. Niña shares her challenges in settling into the city alone and her hesitations in connecting to the local Filipino community.
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Derick Gonzales
description: Kathleen talks to Storyteller Derick Gonzales about growing up in Mount Pleasant and being a K-12 student in Saint Patrick’s Parish community. They grew up a year apart in the elementary school and became friends through youth leadership groups at the parish. As a kuya turned coach, he co-founded Journey Basketball, a sport development program for youth that has its roots in giving back to the community he was raised in.
subject: Immigration; Community; Placemaking; Home; Homeland
location: Mount Pleasant; St. Patrick Elementary School; Tita's House; Saint Patrick Regional Secondary School; Pampanga’s Cuisine
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Jotham Villanueva
description: Kathleen talks to Storyteller Jotham Villanueva about his reflections on his mom’s immigration story, comparisons of their upbringings around Saint Patrick’s Parish, and his expanding feelings of home from East Vancouver and beyond. Their paths first crossed as kids at the church’s summer camp, then at a Filipino-run music studio; from music to now photography and videography, their connection endures through a shared love for the arts.
subject: Immigration; Family; Community; Placemaking; Home; Language; Generational Differences
location: University of British Columbia; Bacolod; Pampanga
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Grace Escueta
description: Kathleen talks to Storyteller Grace Escueta about her family’s immigration story to Canada as musicians, growing up Korean-Filipino, and her reflections on Filipino identity as she moved from Surrey to Vancouver after high school. As fellow musicians and music lovers, they met through their involvement in music clubs at UBC.
subject: Immigration; Family; Community; Placemaking; Home; Language; Generational Differences
location: Richmond; Surrey; University of British Columbia
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Jocelle Refol (Part 1)
description: Kathleen talks to fellow Storymaker Jocelle Refol about experiences growing up with her large extended family in Greater Vancouver and her journey navigating Filipino identity as a “second-gen.” As friends who met through organizing in Sliced Mango Collective, they reflect on meanings of home as they both experience moving away from Vancouver for the first time and pursue graduate studies in Toronto.
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.

title: Interview with Jocelle Refol (Part 2)
rights: This work is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International.
